channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of bulk stuff dumped here, 13th August
item.description:
Lots do fly tipping here. Everywhere a southwark tipper van comes here and get loaded by other vans looks lile builders. I have told the southwark guys to stop doing it but theu dont. I have seen them being handed cash from the other van

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rye Hill Park, Nunhead, London

item.title: New lamp post without light at Manordene Road, 13th August
item.description:
A new lamp post was installed nearly 6/8 weeks ago, but it was not secured with base concrete or mortar and still has no working lights. The post is unstable and could fall â€” please inspect. Additionally, the old lamp post has not been completely removed, and the new lamp post is not yet operational.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manordene Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Majority of footway and road needs sweeping of rubbish, 13th August
item.description:

item.title: Sofa dumped by black bin Nutbourne Street W10 4HW, 13th August
item.description:
1 sofa dumped by black bin in Nutbourne Street W10 4HW, can it please be removed. Is there any chance this bin can be moved to outside someone else's house or outside the community centre as they seem to fill it up regularly and we are fed up with looking out at the rubbish day in and day out. Fed up resident, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Nutbourne Street, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Needles - drugs, 13th August
item.description:
Drugs needles exposed to public: specific danger to children and animals. These need clearing asap. There has been an increase in unsociable behaviour and squatting in this area - I suggest more patrols, dissuasion activity and migration techniques are required by the authority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: Top of glengall rd near kilburn high rd, 13th August
item.description:
3 potholes quite close together, one by a man hole and right in the middle of the rd and a hazard to cyclists. If you avoid this one you then have to take care not to fall into the next one. Deepest is approx 15cm. Smallest is about 5x20cm. Two larger ones are about 30x50cm. Present for many months but become much deeper over the last 5 days or so.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible sinkhole, 13th August
item.description:
There is a small sinkhole on the pavement, about the size of a tennis ball, that grew bigger when stepped on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gauden Road, Clapham, London

item.title: Overgrown tree, needs pollarding, has caused structural damage to pathway, garden wall, and garden path, 13th August
item.description:
Overgrown tree, needs to be significant cut back, roots breaking through the path, has caused damage to my garden wall, garden path, garden gate, have previously raised my concern with Bromley Council who previously stuck some tar over the exposed root, Jeffing waste of time, I am consulting with an architect to assess root damage to my property and seek compensation ,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, London
